page.title: 09CAR PRODUCTION IN S.E.LUTON
page.content:
Vauxhall Motors are one of Luton's major employers.They came to the town in 1905 from Vauxhall in London attracted by good rail links,cheap electricity and a pool of men out of work.The Luton site occupies 285 acres with a floor area of approx.6.4m sq.ft and a labour force of about 11,300.
The main vehicle manufactured at Luton is the Vauxhall Cavalier.It is available in 3 types:{saloon}(12 models),{hatchback}(12 models) and estate (4 variations).1985 prices range from Â£6118.90 to Â£9540.60.
Vauxhall are part of the multinational General Motors group.Other British factories are at Ellesmere Port(Astra and Chevette cars) and Dunstable (trucks and commercial vehicles).
